intro: Galium mandonii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and garden plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and woodlands. Its stems are usually prostrate or ascending, with small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
